definition: the lair of a wild usually predatory animal
a hollow or cavern used especially as a hideout, a center of secret activity
a subdivision of a Cub Scout pack made up of two or more boys
a small structure built by children as a place to play, hide, or provide shelter
examples: We roamed the fields and made dens in the hedges, dragging old logs and brushwood with scraps of canvas and rope to make shelters to hide in.

definition: to live in or retire to a den
examples: polar bears den in ice caves or snowdrifts
